Class FTPUploadRequest

  • public class FTPUploadRequest
extends UploadRequest
    Creates a new FTP Upload Request.

    • Constructor Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • FTPUploadRequest

        public FTPUploadRequest(Context context,
                        String uploadId,
                        String serverUrl,
                        int port)
        Creates a new FTP upload request.
        Parameters:
        context - application context
        uploadId - unique ID to assign to this upload request.
        It can be whatever string you want, as long as it's unique. If you set it to null or an empty string, an UUID will be automatically generated.
        It's advised to keep a reference to it in your code, so when you receive status updates in UploadServiceBroadcastReceiver, you know to which upload they refer to.
        serverUrl - server IP address or hostname
        port - FTP port

      • FTPUploadRequest

        public FTPUploadRequest(Context context,
                        String serverUrl,
                        int port)
        Creates a new FTP upload request and automatically generates an upload id that will be returned when you call UploadRequest#startUpload().
        Parameters:
        context - application context
        serverUrl - server IP address or hostname
        port - FTP port

        Set the credentials used to login on the FTP Server.
        Parameters:
        username - account username
        password - account password
        Returns:
        FTPUploadRequest

      • addFileToUpload

        public FTPUploadRequest addFileToUpload(String filePath,
                                        String remotePath)
                                 throws FileNotFoundException
        Add a file to be uploaded.
        Parameters:
        filePath - path to the local file on the device
        remotePath - absolute path (or relative path to the default remote working directory) of the file on the FTP server. Valid paths are for example: /path/to/myfile.txt, relative/path/ or myfile.zip. If any of the directories of the specified remote path does not exist, they will be automatically created. You can also set with which permissions to create them by using setCreatedDirectoriesPermissions(UnixPermissions) method.

        Remember that if the remote path ends with /, the remote file name will be the same as the local file, so for example if I'm uploading /home/alex/photos.zip into images/ remote path, I will have photos.zip into the remote images/ directory.

        If the remote path does not end with /, the last path segment will be used as the remote file name, so for example if I'm uploading /home/alex/photos.zip into images/vacations.zip, I will have vacations.zip into the remote images/ directory.
        Returns:
        FTPUploadRequest
        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException - if the local file does not exist

      • addFileToUpload

        public FTPUploadRequest addFileToUpload(String filePath,
                                        String remotePath,
                                        UnixPermissions permissions)
                                 throws FileNotFoundException
        Add a file to be uploaded.
        Parameters:
        filePath - path to the local file on the device
        remotePath - absolute path (or relative path to the default remote working directory) of the file on the FTP server. Valid paths are for example: /path/to/myfile.txt, relative/path/ or myfile.zip. If any of the directories of the specified remote path does not exist, they will be automatically created. You can also set with which permissions to create them by using setCreatedDirectoriesPermissions(UnixPermissions) method.

        Remember that if the remote path ends with /, the remote file name will be the same as the local file, so for example if I'm uploading /home/alex/photos.zip into images/ remote path, I will have photos.zip into the remote images/ directory.

        If the remote path does not end with /, the last path segment will be used as the remote file name, so for example if I'm uploading /home/alex/photos.zip into images/vacations.zip, I will have vacations.zip into the remote images/ directory.
        permissions - UNIX permissions for the uploaded file
        Returns:
        FTPUploadRequest
        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException - if the local file does not exist

      • addFileToUpload

        public FTPUploadRequest addFileToUpload(String filePath)
                                 throws FileNotFoundException
        Add a file to be uploaded in the default working directory of the account used to login into the FTP server. The uploaded file name will be the same as the local file name, so if you are uploading /path/to/myfile.txt, you will have myfile.txt inside the default remote working directory. If any of the directories of the specified remote path does not exist, they will be automatically created. You can also set with which permissions to create them by using setCreatedDirectoriesPermissions(UnixPermissions) method.
        Parameters:
        filePath - path to the local file on the device
        Returns:
        FTPUploadRequest
        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException - if the local file does not exist

      • setConnectTimeout

        public FTPUploadRequest setConnectTimeout(int milliseconds)
        Sets the FTP connection timeout. The default value is defined in FTPUploadTaskParameters.DEFAULT_CONNECT_TIMEOUT.
        Parameters:
        milliseconds - timeout in milliseconds
        Returns:
        FTPUploadRequest

      • setSocketTimeout

        public FTPUploadRequest setSocketTimeout(int milliseconds)
        Sets FTP socket timeout. This affects login, logout and change working directory timeout. The default value is defined in FTPUploadTaskParameters.DEFAULT_SOCKET_TIMEOUT.
        Parameters:
        milliseconds - timeout in milliseconds
        Returns:
        FTPUploadRequest

      • useCompressedFileTransferMode

        public FTPUploadRequest useCompressedFileTransferMode(boolean value)
        Sets if the compressed file transfer mode should be used. If your server supports it, this will allow you to use less bandwidth to transfer files, however some additional processing has to be made on your device. By default compressed file transfer mode is disabled and if enabled it works only if it's both supported and enabled on your FTP server.
        Parameters:
        value - true to enable compressed file transfer mode, false to disable it and use the default streaming mode
        Returns:
        FTPUploadRequest

      • setCreatedDirectoriesPermissions

        public FTPUploadRequest setCreatedDirectoriesPermissions(UnixPermissions permissions)
        Sets the UNIX permissions to set to newly created directories (if any). This may happen if you upload files to directories which does not exist on your FTP server. They will be automatically created. If null is set here or you never call this method, the default permissions for new folders set on your FTP server will be applied.
        Parameters:
        permissions - UNIX permissions to set to newly created directories
        Returns:
        FTPUploadRequest

      • setNotificationConfig

        public FTPUploadRequest setNotificationConfig(UploadNotificationConfig config)

      • setAutoDeleteFilesAfterSuccessfulUpload

        public FTPUploadRequest setAutoDeleteFilesAfterSuccessfulUpload(boolean autoDeleteFiles)

        public FTPUploadRequest setMaxRetries(int maxRetries)
